text:
A Question of Development

Two friends debate in a dimly lit room.  
“Are you developing her? He-he!”  

“Not at all! You misunderstand development!”  

“I respect her dignity. I wait in hopes.”  

---  

A friend leans forward, intrigued.  
“Make her a present! Did you think of that?”  

“You despise her! You refuse to see her character!”  

“She's given up reading. I used to lend her books.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation reveals a character's belief in the importance of women's freedom and dignity, while critiquing societal prejudices against them.
